What’s better than Mestil’s Half Dead Juggernaut?  A regenerating one….

Special Abilities & Strengths
  • Woodland Stride (poor man’s Freedom)
  • Craft, Disable and Set up to all Deadly Traps
  • Damage Reduction 9/-
  • Undispellable Buffs
  • Spell Power of a Level 31 Caster
  • Epic Warding
  • Other Forms of Note: Risen Lord, Spectre, Kobold Commando
  • High Hit points and Fort Save
  • Can craft scrolls, potions and wands
 
Weaknesses:
  • You only get 3 Undead Forms a day
  • Can’t cast while shifted
  • There’s no way to heal while your shifted (that’s why you’re a Vamp!)*
  • No discipline, so susceptible to Knockdown (but Spectre form gets immunity so you can use that in a pinch)
 
*In a party, your compatriots can heal you via the Inflict/Harm line of spells.  Similarily, if your environment provides for potions of these, then you’re good as gold.
 
Builder’s Commentary:
I’ve jumped the shark again.  This is another munchkin whackadoodle.  It’s very similar to Bromium’s little known gem, “Ok, I’ll Tank” , except I added steroids to it.  One of my complaints with his build is that while it grabbed Undead Shape at Level 21, it didn’t gain even 4th level Wizard casting until Level 25.  Without Monk levels, this made pre-epic leveling problematic (unless in a party).  I wanted something with a bit more of a solo-punch.  So, I flipped it on it’s head, and preloaded Wizard up front.  I then add Druid, but only token levels for I invest no points in Wisdom.  I still get EDR III, and Undead Shape comes at Level 27.  The goal of the build was to become another Hit-me-Mage but uses Shifter to achieve that end.  Along the way he gains a few other shapes that may be useful, he has enough trap proficiencies to give you another option, and is still a formidable wizard in his own right.  Unlike Bromium, I dropped Epic Gargoyle form and instead am relying solely on Undead Form as well as grabbing that Wizard level 25.  If one wanted, they could always toss in that last Shifter level (11) and grab it.
 
In playtesting, I pitted him against a Prismatic Dragon and he won handily utilizing Undead Shape and damage shields.  I then ran him against a 6 40th level characters at the same time and again he beat them all simultaneously.  At one point he did get stripped by a well-placed Disjunction.  When that happened, I unshifted, Greater Sanct, and reloaded.  When hit again, I unshifted, Time-stopped everything, and unleashed an unholy hell of Maximized IGMS.
 
Brew potion is taken to allow him to access some spells while shifted (Invis, etc.).  Epic Warding is taken for that extra bit of beefy protection. 
 
Dwarf was chosen because I prefer their stat spread to the Gnome, but one should be aware there is an xp penalty beyond 12th level with a Dwarf.  Most folks will take a gnome, but not me….
 
The build focuses on the Vampire form for the crit immunity and regeneration.  All items and armor merge (but not weapons since shifter vamps use hands, bite and Domination gaze).  Items to be coveted are anything that grants Con and Int bonuses along with other immunities (Fire and Acid being foremost).  While Con is not overridden by Vampire form, I did notice an irregularity when shifted.  It seemed to drop Con by 2.  So, when I had my Con maxed at 42, when shifted to Vampire it went to 40.  I can’t account for why but that’s I discovered and there’s no mention of this in any documentation.  It could be a 2da limitation where some Bioware tech probably thought Con28 was the maximum attainable (when really the maximum is 32, 44 fully buffed).
 
Finally, one will notice that the AB and AC in this build is trash.  This is the point in a build.  You don’t need to hit anything, and you want everybody to hit you.  There are a few other Wizard/Druid/Shifters in the old ECB, but they focus on Rakshasa shape, Drow warrior, or are mutts.
 
Interested to know if anyone else has tried something like this, or if anyone has tips or tricks of the trade to improve upon this idea.  If anyone tries to play this in one of their favorite haunts, I’m also keen to hear of the results.  Cheers!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The build concept works well for party PvM in my experience, although I prefer focusing on Risen Lord over Vampire for the DI.

Wiz24/Dru5/Shif11 lets you get Epic Gargoyle as a backup form, but you should be fine without it.

The main suggestion I have is to increase your Will to counter Undeath To Death. You have high fortitude for Implosion and undead immunities against death magic but UTD is a real pain to deal with as an undead shifter.

As for why your CON drops, you lose the dwarven +2 CON racial increase when shifted. This applies to all races and abilities (with the exception of Drow Warrior), if you made an elf vampire you would get +2 CON when shifted since you lose the -2 CON racial decrease.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The main difference between wildshape (Druid and Shifter) forms and polymorph (Polymorph Self and Shapechange) forms is item merging. Armor, helmet, and shield slots merge for all wildshape forms, while no items merge for any polymorph forms. In this particular case, other item slots (apart from bracers/gloves which don't merge for any wildshape forms) also merge for both Risen Lord and Vampire, while weapon properties merge for Risen Lord form.

Despite a Vampire Wiz/Shif having some benefits such as extra immunities and elemental DR, I think a Wiz/PM would be a better option in general. Comparing Vampire and Iron Golem, the Vampire has +8 CON, elemental DR, +5 regen, and better item merging in comparison to the Iron Golem.
A Risen Lord Wiz/Shif gets 50% Piercing DI and 50% Slashing DI in addition to undead immunities which helps differentiate it from a Wiz/PM or Iron Golem tank.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Yes, Yunim highlighted the main differences, and I think overall how a PM is more flexible vs a Shifter variant.  While this concept is not completely original, it does illustrate the variety one can achieve with this game.  One of the other perks for this Shifter variant is that you do have a few other forms that could be useful in certain situations, kobo commando being chief among them.  

Besides the merging of item properties (this unto itself is its own thread to understand what merges, why it merges, and why other things don't merge), there is one more important distinction that makes a Shifter Undead shape superior to the Shapechange spell -- a Shifter's shape cannot be dispelled.

Back to merging, when you shift into, say, Vampire form any items with properties will merge with you and become part of your shape properties.  This would include both Ring slots, Amulet slot, Boot Slot, Belt slot, Armor slot, Helmet slot, Shield slot (if any) and Cloak slot.  Say you have a Ring of Major Fire Resistance and a Ring of Regeneration, and then say you have an Amulet of Acid Resistance, and then say you have a Greater Swordsman Belt, and a Cloak of Stamina +5, and Boots of Astounding Grip.  When you shift, all of those wonderful properties merge onto your shifter form.  It should be noted that ability bonuses will not stack and only the highest is applied when merging.  The same is true for AC values.  Only the highest AC value is retained.  So there's no payoff for having a bunch of AC enhancing items; you only need the one with the highest value.

It can be converted with a small amount of effort, which I have done before:

I used the simplest method:
Make the file 256x400pixels, put it in the NWN portraits directory
Then use the convertportrait command in the console (accessed using the ~ or tilde key) which will create the file into the 5 tga files of varying sizes which can be used in the game. if the file is file.jpg, then the command is ConvertPortrait file (ie no extension)

This is the guide I used:  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/ ... 1344346521
